Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of two Coptic characters written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394529) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394529)
